content: What is the status of HL7 v3 (other than CDA use)?
It's stable but being slowly moved to history
so there has been some formal declaration?

They have not been formally deprecated but there has been a statement that no new work will be done on the V3 RIM and some IGs will be withdrawn if they are inactive. Workgroups now have to provide proof that a V3 IG is needed before an STU can be extended or renewed.
will the V3 specification be made publicly available? (Or do I simply not know where it is publicly published? It seems to be only behind the membership wall.)
I'm in favor of making things publicly available in general. However, do we want to do that with a spec that it would be ill-advised for implementers to pick up?

I am more interested in accessibility to specification that is currently in use. For example IHE-XCPD is used for patient discovery in cross-community health exchanges, and it uses v3. But, today someone trying to use that very specific specification can't get access to the underlying specification. Refusing to publish the specification does not make the problem go away. That said, I do have sympathy for not promulgating use of v3 that re not in current use.
How long has IHE-XCPD been around? How much of a problem has it been?
XCPD has been around since 2010
There is an on-line version but that is a members-only, you would need to talk to the Powers That Be to get access otherwise
So, if it's been working for 12 years, I'm hard-pressed to understand the driver for a change now...
There's a lot of broken links in profiles.ihe.net
ask @David Pyke who put in a Change-Proposal on the IHE Technical framework.... saying he couldn't get to the specification.

V3 specs are available as a download, not hosted publicly. There is a members-only version (benefit of membership!) at http://www.hl7.org/documentcenter/private/standards/v3/edition_web/welcome/environment/index.html
understood... hence why I asked if there was any movement to make it not members only.
seems the answer is "no".
and the V3 domains are being retired one by one as they come up for reaffirmation and the WG does not intend to maintain or enhance them
correct, no. :shrug:
fair. Ask a question and you might not get the answer you want.
it seems IHE is going to need to direct all our links to V3 to a landing page that explains these facts.
can start with https://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=186

I think board policy is that we're allowed to make all of our specs publicly available now. The only question is whether that's truly in the best interests of the community going forward. If we did do so, I'd sort of like to put a wrapper around it that says "This has been made publicly available to support existing use, however this content is not endorsed for net new adoption" or something like that.
that would be most excellent. I have 567 links in the IHE ITI Technical Framework to v3.
all currently going to v3 ballot 2007 -- which likely was not proper.

they are deep links.. so a shame to lose those deep links. for example

<a href="http://hl7.org/v3ballot2007may/html/infrastructure/rim/rim.htm#QueryByParameter-cls">QueryByParameter</a>
if you're linking to the RIM which version is appropriate? 2007 is not the latest.
but I am guessing the latest is just as not-available
I recognized above that I note the links IHE currently is using was likely not proper... oops, wasn't me.

also

  • datatypes - e.g. http://hl7.org/v3ballot2007may/html/infrastructure/datatypes/datatypes.htm#dt-II
  • vocabulary - e.g. http://hl7.org/v3ballot2007may/html/infrastructure/vocabulary/QueryStatusCode.htm#QueryStatusCode
  • uvci - e.g., http://hl7.org/v3ballot2007may/html/domains/uvci/uvci_GenericMessageTransmission.htm
all result in a 404 from HL7 web-site... would be nice if HL7 redirected these to their v3 product_brief
I can easily change the root to something HL7 would like, while not changing the path or anchor
or I change them all to drop the user at the product brief.
either will be nicer to the user than a 404 from the hl7 website

we have moved these from the original locally hosted archive and the URLs have changed. you may want to use the most recent: replace the hl7.org/v3ballot2007may... with http://v3ballot.hl7.org/v3ballotarchive/v3ballot2018jan
see also http://www.hl7.org/v3ballotarchive/v3ballot/html/
Changing the root of the url to http://www.hl7.org/v3ballotarchive/v3ballot/html fixes John's problem
As long as he's good with the latest ballot version
Note that the IG publisher (for FHIR IGs) puts in links to http://hl7.org/comparison-v3.html and http://hl7.org/v3 -- which also give 404

David Pyke said:

Changing the root of the url to http://www.hl7.org/v3ballotarchive/v3ballot/html fixes John's problem

This does seem to fix my links.. but is it the right thing?
http://www.hl7.org/v3ballotarchive/v3ballot/html/domains/uvci/uvci_GenericMessageTransmission.htm
instead of http://hl7.org/v3ballot2007may/html/domains/uvci/uvci_GenericMessageTransmission.htm
That seems to be the same information (based on memory, not a hard knowledge of V3)

Lynn Laakso said:

V3 specs are available as a download, not hosted publicly. There is a members-only version (benefit of membership!) at http://www.hl7.org/documentcenter/private/standards/v3/edition_web/welcome/environment/index.html

What about linking to something under this root? If I'm understanding correctly, that is more recent/correct than the ballot version. The downside is that if you don't have HL7 membership, you don't have access, but isn't that needed anyhow to implement v3?
note the link Dave found does not require membership
Yes, but it also isn't the published version.
PR created -- https://github.com/IHE/publications/pull/161
I am also creating a PR where I just remove all links

Hello, as per the hl7 release document(https://vico.org/CDAR22005_HL7SP/infrastructure/cda/cda.htm#link) , we come to know that narrative block and entry block consists same level of data structure , however, my vendor sent file where some narrative data were missed in the entry tag. Could you please help me ? how this work narrative and entry section?

Hi everyone, it's good to be here.

I am new in FHIR and so I have a question to ask.
What do I need to do if I were to build an FHIR production server or what other production servers would you recommend?

You should start with separate threads for new topics.

Your question is too broad. If you can narrow it down to specific questions, we can help you better.
@Er.Madhav Adhikari This is probably best asked in #CDA
ok I will ask in CDA stream.
@Lloyd McKenzie I can not find the CDA stream. Do you mea i need to ask CDA officer or in this community chat?
#CDA

Click on the #CDA stream. There are a lot of streams available. When you first sign up, you're only registered on a couple of them by default. Click on the icons beside the "STREAMS" label to see them all.
@Lloyd McKenzie sorry for inconvenienced . I am new to this form . Now I got it.
Standards behind paywalls put them at a distinct developer experience disadvantage to proprietary formats
XCPD et al are still incredibly hard to develop to for new entrants
But they're in TEFCA and popular in other countries too
Publish V3 publicly. Hiding tribal knowledge does no one any good
It is available for download for free. It's just not web published for non-member

Given research by @David Pyke and advice from @Lynn Laakso ; I have proposed two different methods of improving the IHE Technical Framework that relies on HL7 v3. (including XCPD). Will see which alternative the committee and community likes.
I'm for the one that translates all of ITI TF2 to use X12 messages

David Pyke said:

I'm for the one that translates all of ITI TF2 to use X12 messages

#AprilFools
Really? That needed to be said?
